description.p: Not all wizards spend their entire lives reading books in a library and hiding from combat throwing spells from afar. Some prefer to stand next to their opponent as they launch a firebolt into their chest. Though often frowned upon these mages stand in the thick of combat an it isn't uncommon for them to use weapons as spell focuses.
As you have studied close quarters combat you have become proficient in light armour, additionally you are able to use any weapon you are proficient with as an arcane focus.

description.p: When you cast a spell, that spell is no longer capable of damaging you, for example your fireball detonating next to your face will not harm you. Additionally you no longer have disadvantage within 5ft and any spell attacks within 5ft are treated as melee attacks (no disadvantage for prone). Additionally at 6th level you are able to dictate which creatures in your area of effect spells are effected, creating small pockets of protected space.

description.p: When you cast a spell, instead of casting it at a range you can teleport up to the target as long as the spell would reach to an an unoccupied space, (a 30ft spell allows you to teleport 30ft towards a creature but only if the spell hits) you must then make this spell attack within 5ft. Once done this reduces your speed to 0 if it were not already. If you do this a creature has disadvantage on dexterity saves as it would be surprised.

description.p: When you roll to check if you keep up concentration after an attack, all creatures in melee range must make a dexterity save against your spell save DC or take 1d6 magic damage (overcomes all resistances and immunities) per spell level.
